sentences.english: As soon as the baby cormorant breaks the eggs, it is watched by Damin himself.
sentences.chinese: 小鸬鹚一啄破蛋壳，大明就亲自照看它。

sentences.english: The bird pecked finish, gently comb with rice sleek feathers.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿啄完稻谷，轻轻梳理着光润的羽毛。

sentences.english: Afterwards, pecking-acupuncture technique was done on Renzhong (GV 26) to achieve strong stimulation for 10 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 继续针刺人中，施雀啄手法强刺激10下。

sentences.english: This bird employs its beak as a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 用鸟喙啄了几下就让这条蛇一命呜呼了。

sentences.english: That chick pecks out an earthworm from the earth.
sentences.chinese: 那只小鸡从土里啄出一条蚯蚓。

sentences.english: She does not like the hen that pecks all day.
sentences.chinese: 她不喜欢这个整天啄来啄去的母鸡。

sentences.english: Many people believe that chickens peck the ground to search for the magic needle.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为，鸡啄地面搜寻魔术针。

sentences.english: It was the sparrow pecking at the sportsmen.
sentences.chinese: 这是小麻雀在追啄猎人。

sentences.english: The crow pecks the fox with his long, sharp beak. The fox cries with pain.
sentences.chinese: 小乌鸦用尖嘴巴啄了小狐狸一下，小狐狸疼得哭起来。

sentences.english: They flew at its eyes and pecked and pecked.
sentences.chinese: 它们飞向老虎的眼睛，不停地啄它地眼珠。

sentences.english: Swans can give you a nasty peck.
sentences.chinese: 天鹅可能给你严重的一啄。

sentences.english: Probably an immature male Scarlet-backed Flowerpecker.
sentences.chinese: 可能是未成年的雄性朱背啄花鸟吧。

sentences.english: Why don't woodpeckers get a headache from banging their heannouncementsthereforest wood nearly all day?
sentences.chinese: 为什么啄木鸟整日用头啄树而不头疼？

sentences.english: The birds cling to the wall and nibble at the brickwork.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿们紧贴在墙上，啄着砖缝。

definition: (of a bird) to peck at food
to go off like a rocket/to rocket
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
